intro: Cyclobalanopsis nanchuanica, commonly known as the Nanchuan ironwood, is a deciduous tree native to China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and beeches, and is characterized by its hard, durable wood. The tree produces small, cupule-enclosed nuts that are dispersed by animals. It thrives in mountainous regions with high elevation and cool, moist climates. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and valuable species in its native habitat.
